intro: Dichapetalum madagascariense var. brevistylum, commonly known as the short-stemmed star-fruit tree, is a distinctive plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. The plant has a compact growth habit with short, stout stems and produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
